section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These rules may be cited as the Partition Rules.

subsection.def: pleading (狀書) has the meaning given by R.H.C. Order 1, rule 4(1); (31 of 2025 s. 102)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to proceedings commenced in the Court of First Instance, the Registrar of the High Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to proceedings commenced in a District Court, the Registrar of the High Court exercising his jurisdiction as the Registrar of the District Court by virtue of section 14(4) of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

subsection.content: In these rules any reference to an Order and rule if prefixed by the letters “R.H.C.” is a reference to that Order and rule in the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A). (E.R. 1 of 2021)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Rules of High Court and District Court
section.content: Subject to the Ordinance and these rules the practice and procedure of the High Court and of the District Court as may be appropriate, including the provisions relating to commencement of proceedings shall apply to proceedings under the Ordinance as nearly as circumstances admit.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Documents to be served on the Director
section.leadIn: In any proceedings under the Ordinance a copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of every pleading and amended pleading filed in Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of every affidavit filed in Court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of every answer to interrogatories and of all particulars furnished or filed in Court, whether pursuant to an order of the Court or otherwise;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of every interlocutory application, and every order made thereon filed in Court; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: of every notice, including notices of appeal, filed in Court,

section.continued: shall forthwith after such filing or furnishing be served or caused to be served on the Director by the party on behalf of whom such document is filed or furnished.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Application by Secretary for Justice to be added as a party
section.content: An application by the Secretary for Justice under section 3A of the Ordinance to be added as a party may be made ex parte by summons to a judge of the Court in which the proceedings are pending or to the Registrar, but the judge or Registrar may, if he thinks fit, require the attendance of the Secretary for Justice on the application.

subsection.leadIn: Where any document is required by the Ordinance or these rules to be served on the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: service may be effected by sending the document by post or delivering it to the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it shall not be necessary for the Director to acknowledge service of such document;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: if due service has not been effected or no affidavit of service has been filed in Court, the Court shall, subject to subparagraph (e), adjourn the hearing on such terms as to costs or otherwise as it thinks fit, in order that service may be effected or an affidavit of service filed; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if due service has been effected but no affidavit of service filed in Court, the Court may proceed with the hearing if the party required to file such affidavit satisfies the Court that service has been effected and gives an undertaking to Court to file an affidavit of service within such time as may be directed by Court.

subsection.content: In any proceedings under the Ordinance, the provisions of R.H.C. Order 63, rule 4 in respect of inspection and obtaining copies of any document filed in the registry of the Court shall apply to the Director as if he were a party to the proceedings.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Notices to be in writing
section.content: Unless otherwise directed any notice required by the Ordinance or these rules to be given shall be given in writing.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Service on the Secretary for Justice
section.content: Service of any document on the Secretary for Justice in any proceedings under the Ordinance may be effected by sending the document by post, or delivering it, to the Secretary for Justice.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Length of stay of proceedings
section.content: The period during which any proceedings are stayed by section 3B of the Ordinance shall be 21 days.
